Description: This national landmark, built by Adler and Sullivan in 1899, is a major center for the performing arts in Chicago. Home to the Joffrey Ballet, the theatre also hosts dance companies from around the world, pop music stars and Broadway plays. Additional access information, including seating charts, is available online or at 312-431-2389 ext. 0.
Street: 50 E. Congress Pkwy. (Cross Street: S. Michigan Av

TheatreName: North Shore Center for the Performing Arts
Description: This center, which has two theatres, is a cultural beacon for the various North Shore communities. The state-of-the-art facility, which opened in 1996, is home to three distinct resident companies: Centre East, Northlight Theatre, and Skokie Valley Symphony Orchestra. Centre East presents music, dance, comedy and family programs while Northlight Theatre is known for its interpretations of contemporary plays and musicals, adventurous world premieres, and original adaptations of the classics.
htmlWhat:
North Shore Center for the Performing Arts

This center, which has two theatres, is a cultural beacon for the various North Shore communities. The state-of-the-art facility, which opened in 1996, is home to three distinct resident companies: Centre East, Northlight Theatre, and Skokie Valley Symphony Orchestra. Centre East presents music, dance, comedy and family programs while Northlight Theatre is known for its interpretations of contemporary plays and musicals, adventurous world premieres, and original adaptations of the classics.

Description: This revolutionary outdoor concert venue in Millennium Park, with its billowing sculpture of brushed stainless steel ribbons, is home to the Grant Park Music Festival and other free concerts and events. Frank Gehry, its designer, also conceived the pavilion's unique sound system which distributes sound evenly via an overarching trellis which extends over the lawn area at the rear of the performance space.
Street: 205 E. Randolph Dr. (Cross Street: N. Michigan Ave
htmlWhat:
Pritzker Pavilion

This revolutionary outdoor concert venue in Millennium Park, with its billowing sculpture of brushed stainless steel ribbons, is home to the Grant Park Music Festival and other free concerts and events. Frank Gehry, its designer, also conceived the pavilion's unique sound system which distributes sound evenly via an overarching trellis which extends over the lawn area at the rear of the performance space.

205 E. Randolph Dr. (Cross Street: N. Michigan Ave
Chicago, Il 60601
Phone Number: (312) 742-7638

  • Wheelchair Spaces - 25+

    • Seating charts are available online.

htmlRestroom:
Accessible Public Restroom

  • Men's and Women's
  • Access symbol identifies facility
  • Entry door at least 32" clearance
  • Threshold less than 1/2" beveled
  • Space in restroom to maneuver-5' by 5' or T-shaped space to turn
  • Wheelchair stall 60" by 58"/60" minimum
  • Stall door at least 32" clearance
  • Stall door swings out
  • Grab bar behind and alongside toilet
  • Lateral transfer space at least 30" wide
  • Toilet height 17" to 19"
  • Roll under sink with knee clearance at least 27" high and 30" wide
  • Insulated sink pipes
  • Mirror 40" or less from floor or tilted
  • Towels/soap/vending within reach-48" or less from floor
  • Faucet controls lever type
  • Easy grasp/lever handle or none
  • Location: Lobby
  • Notes:
    • Restroom has 2 wheelchair stalls
    • Accessible restrooms also located on lower level, fourth, sixth and seventh floors
  • An accessible unisex restroom is located on the Terrace level

Street: 220 E. Chicago Ave. (Cross Street: Mies van der Ro
htmlWhat:
Museum of Contemporary Art

220 E. Chicago Ave. (Cross Street: Mies van der Ro
Chicago, Il 60611
Phone Number: (312) 280-2660
www.mcachicago.org

Parking/Loading Zone

  • Accessible loading zone
  • Private parking lot with designated accessible spaces
  • Note: Garage is run by InterPark, 220 E. Chicago, 312-985-2024
    • Accessible entrance from the garage is on the 2nd level, but one must call ahead to the museum to be admitted
    • Validate parking ticket at admissions to receive discount
htmlDeaf:
Features for People with Hearing Loss

  • Captioning of videos/films
  • Strobe fire alarms in public areas
  • Strobe fire alarms in restrooms
  • Public phone with volume control
  • Assistive listening system
    • Devices available from admission desk
  • Elevator has visual indicators
  • TTY public phone
    • Location - lobby near theatre
htmlBlind:
Features for People with Vision Loss

  • Server will read caf? menu on request
  • Height clearance at least 80"
  • No undetectable protruding objects in path of travel
  • Elevator has audible indicators
  • Braille/Tactile Signage: elevator controls, hoistways, restrooms, emergency exits
  • Interior Signage: large print, high contrast, non-glare
  • Nearest grassy/dog relief area
    • Schulman Park, across street
  • Information in alternate formats-Braille guides
    • Available from-admission desks
  • Note: Magnifying glasses are also available at the admission desks

  • 2 doors in series-adequate space between
  • Threshold less than 1/2" beveled
  • Automatic or push button door

htmlRestroom:
Accessible Public Restroom

  • Men's and Women's
  • Entry door at least 32" clearance
  • Threshold less than 1/2" beveled
  • Space in restroom to maneuver-5' by 5' or T-shaped space to turn
  • Stall door at least 32" clearance
  • Stall door swings out or has clearance beyond door swing
  • Grab bar behind and alongside toilet
  • Lateral transfer space at least 30" wide
  • Toilet height 17" to 19"
  • Ambulatory stall-grab bars on both sides of toilet
  • Roll under sink with knee clearance at least 27" high and 30" wide
  • Mirror 40" or less from floor or tilted
  • Towels/soap/vending within reach-48" or less from floor
  • Faucet controls automatic or lever type
  • Latch operable with closed fist
  • Easy grasp/lever handle or none
  • Location-Lobby near theatre
  • Notes:
    • Lobby restroom has 2 wheelchair stalls and 2 ambulatory stalls
    • A unisex accessible restroom, located in Puck's Express, lacks easy grasp/lever door handle and latch
